1. The Facts About Being Highly Sensitive: A (Wrong) Sense of Being Flawed
everyone feels best when neither too bored or too aroused
better at spotting errors and avoid making errors
vigilance, accuracy, speed, detect minor differences
learn without being aware we learned
affected by other people's moods & emotions
"think about all the possible effects of an idea"
(E) think of 3 major changes in your life
consider response with what you know
think if there is anything to be done now
write down old&new views of the experience
2. Digging Deeper: Understand Your Trait for All That It Is
Low 1, Lower 2  calm, quiet, content with simple life
High 1, Higher 2 curious & cautious, easy bored, easyover-aroused=>narrowoptimal arousal
- anger & frustration when not getting what you want
3. General Health and Lifestyle for HSPs: Loving and Learning From Your Infant/Body Self
pure (!= physical, effort,concentration) -> most deep rest
4. Reframing Your Childhood and Adolescence: Learning to Parent Yourself
talk about the situation, focus on what is familiar & safe
allow yourself to go home if you need to
expect to be OK after adjusting
respondwith no more anxiety than the braver part thinks justified
"There sure is a lot going on here, it makes your heart pound with excitement doesn't it?"
HSP-girls don't have to put on the armor
praise yourself for taking risks and learning new things <-> success
give yourself opportunities to interact with other gifted people
be your own advocate, support your right to be yourself
5 ways to handle over-arousal in social situations
explain your trait to others -> 2 stereotypes
persona: choosing the level of openness
say them in the next sentence
energy goes towards the quiet people
shyness is not your trait, it's a state everyone can feel
introverted social style is as valuable as the extroverted style
6. Thriving at Work: Follow Your Bliss and Let Your Light Shine Through
sensitivity is the key in successful parenting
7. Close Relationships: The Challenge of Sensitive Love
hard, unrealistic crush -> after period of isolation
liking certain things about the other
be declared to that she loves me
high level of arousal -> self expansion, excitement ->attractedto someone
take charge and decide you will stay home when fatigued
explain why you need the break
state when you'll be available again -> keep promise
reflective listening: say the feelings back
feelings are never wrong nor right

HSP's that are not stressed or shy are more healthy
"quick fix does not exist" => "hard work in psychotherapy"
10. Soul and Spirit: Where True Treasure Lies
half: soul spirit life that defined them
half: inner life, philosophy, religion, spiritual practices => new energy
"we can only trust science"  but science doesn'tanswerthe big questions
"HSP's lead in the search for wholeness
shadow: unethical impulseswechoose not to do

(Concerning thedistinction between sensitivity and introversion, Aron and her husband Arthur Aron published a 1997 paper "Sensory-Processing Sensitivity and its Relation to Introversion and Emotionality."
Aron, Elaine M., and Aron, Arthur,
"Sensory-Processing Sensitivity and its Relation to Introversion and Emotionality"
Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
